title: I can't tell Malzahar's icon from Kennen's now.
body:
Could you tweak the icons so that {{champion:90}} and {{champion:85}} are a little more distinct?

All I can see are purple hoods which make them basically the same.  If you could at least see a little more of Kennen's face to see the yordle, maybe...

Yes, that WOULD be very useful.

Riot's new art in general has been pretty lackluster.  Kennen look awful in his.  I get that every single bit of art has to be "edgy" and "intense" and full of action-poses, drama and lens flare... but c'mon!  How about it be readable from a distance when it's shrunken down in-game?  And tone back the over-the-top crap. The new Dragon fist Lee Sin skin art is so edgy and extreme it punched my mother in the face and stole her heart pills.  Is a rioter letting their teenage son decide what the splash arts will look like?

Let's not do to League what[ they tried to](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=crFnbxh64uY) do to Looney Tunes... eh?

Yeah, all the new character splashes since about Caitlyn have had more action-packed poses and scenes, but as a result, the recognisability of many champion icons have suffered when shrunk down. 

Kennen's eyes are hard to see on first glance and I agree it looks too similar to Malzahar's.
Hey don't bag on Lunatics Unleashed. Maybe you didn't like it cause it wasn't the same as the original, but it was a damn good show by itself.

It's not about the show being good or not.  It's about changing older characters with fans into something comically "extreme" in an attempt to win new fans, while alienating the people who enjoyed it in the first place and thus were the reason it became a success.

A new show/champion can be harcore, extreme, edgy or whatnot.... but make it a NEW show/champ/whatnot.  Don't take ones people already have a good idea of and fondness for and turn them into something that different unless you want a lot of scathing remarks and jokes at the new thing's expense.
Dragon fist lee splash got a lot shittier, and actually strayed away from the new style they're trying to adopt. Maybe it's a Chinese splash or something.
